abstract: JPMorgan Chase, the banking giant that has weathered the credit crunch better than many of its peers, said Thursday that its second-quarter profit plummeted 53 percent from the same time last year, to about $2 billion.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase, the banking giant that has weathered the credit crunch better than many of its peers, said Thursday that its second-quarter profit plummeted 53 percent from the same time last year, to about $2 billion.

headline.main: JPMorgan Profit Falls 53% Amid Higher Charges
